column4: i have some linux generic updates that wont install, says that it might be a number of reasons, such as a previous install that didnt complete etc. etc. how do i find out why the updates wont install, running intrepid with kernel 2.6.27-10
i think its due to your kernel
there are 4 updates linux-generic. linux-image-generic, linux-headers-generic and linux-restricted-modules-generic that wont install
you are running a newer kernel, not the intrepid  generic kernel, how did you install it?
everything has been installed or updated thru the update manager
have you got some repository added manually?
probably, i'll have a look
this is intrepids kernel, 2.6.27-9-generic
cairo-dock and medibuntu
you have a problem, can you boot an older kernel at the boot menu?
fraid i dont know how to do that...
were would this kernel have com from? i only use the update manager?
i can only guess the repo you used installed it. never seen the problem.
im guessing that something must need it to run or it wouldnt be installed, wondering if booting to a different kernel will cause some problems???
if you're running ok dont downgrade, type uname -r in a terminal, whats the output
2.6.27-10-generic
the updates are 2.6.27-14
sorry s/b 2.6.27-11
you can't be using the proper repositories, you running intrepid?
yea
thats /etc/apt/sources.list
mucked around, everything works great and i'm using 2.6.27-11
